content: to six times double_crochet in double_crochet 2dc in ch2-space double_crochet in 2 double_crochet 3dc in last st 251 double_crochet 14 dc3tog 12 ch1-space if at this point you desire a larger shawl continue working the increases at the edges and apex as already established in the pattern and as you get enough stitches to add in the next dc3tog or double_crochet ch3 double_crochet in the row s pattern repeat add it in once a pattern repeat is established in the row it stays the same throughout subsequent row do not fasten_off turn work to begin working along the neckline neckline edging- linen/moss/granite stitch row 1 ch1 single_crochet in the last double_crochet from row 25 ch1 single_crochet two times in the row end space ch1 single_crochet in the top of the ch3 start chain from row 24 ch1 single_crochet two times in the row end space continue to work the linen stitch evenly and loosely in this same manner across the entire top edge of the shawl working a single_crochet in the double_crochet s and tops of the ch3 s helps to anchor the row securely and keep the stitches from sliding around when you get to the foundation chain single_crochet in the first chain you come to ch1 skip 1 chain single_crochet in next chain until you are opposite a dc3tog from row 2 ch1 close the keyhole by single_crochet in the chain st opposite the next dc3tog from row 2 continue working the linen stitch as previously established to the end of the neckline turn row 2 ch1 single_crochet in first single_crochet single_crochet in ch1-space ch1 single_crochet in next ch1-space across to last ch1-space single_crochet in last single_crochet turn row 3 ch1 single_crochet in first single_crochet ch1 single_crochet in next ch1-space across to last ch1-space ch1 single_crochet in last single_crochet turn row 4-5 repeat row 2-3 fasten_off weave in ends block shawl according to yarn manufacturer s instructions tips for blocking the shawl follow later in the pattern fringe cut 65 16 pieces of yarn using 5 strands of yarn at a time fold the yarn in half insert folded loop of the yarn into a chevron peak/ch1-space make it large enough to pull the tails of the yarn through pull the yarn tails through the folded loop pull down to tighten add fringe to the center/apex stitch saffron shawl 5 this chart shows the foundation chain and first 20 row saffron shawl 6 this chart starts on row 20 it s only a reference for stitch placement for row 21 row 21-25 finish out the main body this chart only shows row beginning/ending and apex the main body stitch pattern that is already established stays the same throughout saffron shawl 7 to make a larger shawl repeat row 18-25 this chart shows row beginnings/endings repeat saffron shawl 8 to make shawl larger repeat row 18-25 this chart shows apex repeat saffron shawl 9 image to show the first 6 row the progression and shape is a little different
